episode_summary: This episode features discussions on the Night Witches, a Soviet female bomber regiment during WWII, the cultural differences in returning lost items between Tokyo and New York, the history of railways in New Zealand, and a 1936 incident where a robot shot its inventor.

facts.fact: The most highly decorated Soviet Air Unit of World War II didn't take part in the victory parade because their planes were too slow.
If you drop a wallet containing cash in Tokyo, you're three times more likely to get it back than if you drop it in New York.
When trains were new in New Zealand, an elderly lady flagged one down by standing on the tracks to see if anyone could give her change for a Â£1 note.
In 1936, a robot in California shot its inventor in the head.
